title: Using asm label locations unsupported
body:
I tried this code: ```rust #![feature(asm,global_asm)] fn main() { unsafe{asm!("int3","mov eax,2f","2:","ret",out("eax") _);} println!("Hello, world!");" } ``` and ```rust #![feature(asm,global_asm)] fn main() { unsafe{test();} println!("Hello, world!"); } global_asm!(".global _test","_test:","int3","mov eax,label","label:","ret"); extern "C"{ fn test(); } ``` I expected to see this happen: I expected the assembly code to look the same, when I look at it (after compilation) with a decompiler (like ida64). And I also expect this code to print "Hello, World!" without the "int3" instruction. The assembly code should put the location of the label 2f (or label in the case of the global_asm example) in the register eax for later use (here not present, for making this simple) Instead, this happened: The mov instruction instead has a weird long value. ![image](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/28912031/141691305-f1750312-1cf9-47cf-81db-b8e8969cc772.png) ### Meta `rustc +nightly-i686 --version --verbose`: ``` rustc 1.58.0-nightly (b416e3892 2021-11-13) binary: rustc commit-hash: b416e3892d9526709f3a248f5ed3a43a970f795e commit-date: 2021-11-13 host: i686-pc-windows-msvc release: 1.58.0-nightly LLVM version: 13.0.0 ```
Backtrace

``` \CLionProjects\asm-ptr-lbl>echo %RUST_BACKTRACE% 1 \CLionProjects\asm-ptr-lbl>cargo +nightly-i686 build Finished dev [unoptimized + debuginfo] target(s) in 0.03s \CLionProjects\asm-ptr-lbl>cargo clean \CLionProjects\asm-ptr-lbl>cargo +nightly-i686 build Compiling asm-ptr-lbl v0.1.0 (C:\Users\timon\CLionProjects\asm-ptr-lbl) Finished dev [unoptimized + debuginfo] target(s) in 0.61s ```

EDIT: Similar issue with "push" ```rust #![feature(asm,global_asm)] fn main() { unsafe{asm!("int3","push 2f","pop ecx","2:","ret",out("eax") _);} println!("Hello, world!"); } ``` and ```rust #![feature(asm,global_asm)] fn main() { unsafe{test();} println!("Hello, world!"); } global_asm!(".global _test","_test:","int3","push label","pop ecx","label:","ret"); extern "C"{ fn test(); } ``` respectively push the value contained at the label, rather than pushing the location of the label. I need the push to work correctly, for doing processor mode switching with a far return [inside rust].
